a1: TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password) is an algorithm that generates temporary codes using a shared secret and the current time. It is the standard behind Google Authenticator and similar apps.
q2: Where do I find my secret key?
a2: When setting up 2FA, the service provides a QR code or a Base32 secret key (like JBSWY3DPEHPK3PXP). This is the key you enter here.
q3: Is this compatible with Google Authenticator?
a3: Yes. TOTP is a standard (RFC 6238). This tool generates the same codes as Google Authenticator, Authy, Microsoft Authenticator, and others.
a4: Yes. Everything runs locally in your browser. Your secret key is never stored or transmitted to any server.
q5: Why is my code different from my authenticator app?
a5: Ensure your device clock is accurate. TOTP codes depend on the current time. Even a few seconds of clock drift can produce different codes.
